sentence.Network_en: The house had been facetiously named by some waggish officer.
sentence.Network_cn: 这房子是由某个机智幽默的军官命名的。

sentence.Network_en: During this melancholy pause , the turnkey read his newspaper with a waggish look.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这个忧郁的停歇期间, 看守滑稽地阅读着报纸.

sentence.Network_en: Muskrat Castle as the house has been facetiously named by some waggish officer - James Fenimore Cooper.
sentence.Network_cn: ‘麝鼠城堡’这个名字是一些爱开玩笑的官员给这座房子取的滑稽名字 —— 詹姆士·菲里莫尔·库珀.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 以w开头的英语英文单词 ... wager 赌,赌博,赌物 waggish 诙谐的，滑稽的 waggly 摇摇晃晃的.
词根及词缀 ... modish a 时髦的 waggish a 滑稽的 sluggish a 行动迟钝的.
t3 flashcards | Quizlet ... extrapolate 推断，推知 waggish 爱开玩笑的 meticulous: 一丝不苟的,精确的.
安又琪 - 搜搜百科 ... VICTORY（ 胜利） WAGGISH（ 幽默可爱（waggish）） Youthful（ 朝气）.

list.abs: waggish remarks , tricks , youngsters ., 诙谐的言语 , 花招 , 年轻人.

sentences.sentence: "Muskrat Castle as the house has been facetiously named by some waggish officer"- James Fenimore Cooper

auth_sentence.content: Mr Tarkington writes in...a vein of waggish farce.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Tarkington writes in...a vein of waggish farce.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Tarkington writes in...a vein of waggish farce.

auth_sentence.content: So the tone of pre-season commenting tends to be waggish and dismissive.
auth_sentence.res_content: So the tone of pre-season commenting tends to be waggish and dismissive.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So the tone of pre-season commenting tends to be waggish and dismissive.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps liberals are less inclined to be waggish about their politics or more inclined to be solemn about their pets.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Perhaps liberals are less inclined to be waggish about their politics or more inclined to be solemn about their pets.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"像……一样,有……的",通常放在具体的名词后; 2. 表动词,"造成……,成……"

stems_affixes.word_buile: slug懒汉+ish像……一样,有……的→sluggish→行动迟钝的,缓慢的
book书+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.书呆子的
boor粗野的人,不懂礼貌的人+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.粗野的
child孩子+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.孩子的;幼稚的
churl粗野的人,吝啬鬼+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.脾气暴躁的
cold冷+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.微冷的
colt小马,无经验的年轻人+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.放浪不拘的,似小马的
fadd时尚+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.流行一时的,时尚的
fat非,胖+ish像……一样,有……的→fattish略胖的
fiend魔鬼+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.极凶恶的
fool愚人,白痴+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.愚笨的,愚蠢的
mode时尚+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.时髦的
self自己+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.自私的
snob势利的人,假内行+ish像……一样,有……的→snobbish势利的,谄上欺下的
wag摇摆,小丑+ish像……一样,有……的→waggish→诙谐的,滑稽的
yellow黄+ish像……一样,有……的→adj.微黄色的
pol擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,擦亮;使优美,润饰 n.擦光剂,上光蜡
di分开+mini小+ish造成……,成……→变小,减少
em进入+bell美好+ish造成……,成……→进入美好→装饰
fam饿+ish造成……,成……→v.使饥饿
flour花+ish造成……,成……→v.繁荣,茂盛;挥舞
furb擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,刷新
im进入+pover贫困+ish造成……,成……→v.使成赤贫
pol擦亮+ish造成……,成……→v.磨光,擦亮;使优美,润饰 n.擦光剂,上光蜡
vanqu克服+ish造成……,成……→v.征服,击溃
